page.title: 16FOOTPATHS (CONT.)
page.content: (Hazelwood Lane) This is a very muddy lane after any rainfall. In parts it is over grown with bushes and is only 1metre wide in places. The surrounding boundaries consist of thick hedges, brambles and trees. Rabbits are a common sight.Near the end of the footpath, it passes through woodland although most of the surrounding landuse is pasture. The footpath passes the Hazelwood Sewage farm. (Billingbear Lane-Wicks Green) The path's condition is generally grassy skirting fields with cattle grazing. There are a nummber of styles. Path boundaries include wooden and wire fences,hedgerows and a stream. Some of the surrounding fields contain wheat and barley. There are a number of farmhouses en route.
